entries.title: Explaining Biden's border strategy: Expelling migrants, expanding some asylum claims
entries.description: The Biden administration last week announced a significant new crackdown on unauthorized migration at the border while opening new legal pathways for some people

entries.title: Former US defense analyst arrested for spying for Cuba released from federal prison
entries.description: A former U.S. defense intelligence agency analyst convicted of spying for Cuba was released from federal prison on Friday, prison officials confirmed with ABC News.

entries.title: Pro-Bolsonaro protesters storm Brazil's Congress, high court
entries.description: Supporters of former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro who refuse to accept his electoral defeat have stormed Congress, the Supreme Court and presidential palace, just a week after the inauguration of his leftist rival, President Luiz Inácio Lula da S...

entries.title: Adam Rich, former 'Eight Is Enough' child star, dies at 54
entries.description: The cute child actor charmed TV audiences in the late 1970s as Nicholas Bradford

entries.title: Amid unrest, Iran's hardliners turn their anger to France
entries.description: Hundreds of protesters including seminary students shouted “Death to France.”

entries.title: Biden focuses on El Paso in his first presidential trip to the US-Mexico border
entries.description: Biden's border visit is expected to try to highlight El Paso as a model for what can be done with the immense task of migration management, a White House official said

entries.title: Terror trial set to begin for suspect in NYC truck attack that killed 8
entries.description: The first federal death penalty trial of the Biden administration opens Monday in New York City, where Sayfullo Saipov is charged with killing eight people.

entries.title: Builders uncover Jewish WWII trove in yard in Poland
entries.description: Media reports say about 400 items believed to have been hidden in the ground by their Jewish owners during World War II have been uncovered during house renovation work in a yard in Lodz in central Poland

entries.title: South Carolina priest charged with federal sex crimes
entries.description: A South Carolina priest who served in the Roman Catholic Diocese of Charleston is facing federal sex crime charges stemming from allegations that he abused an 11-year-old child

entries.title: Russell Banks, praised author of 'Cloudsplitter,' dies at 82
entries.description: Prize-winning author Russell Banks has died

entries.title: 40 people killed, dozens injured in bus crash in Senegal
entries.description: Senegal's president says two buses have collided head-on in the center of the country and that at least 40 people were killed and dozens of others were injured

entries.title: Woman dies after thrown from horse at Florida rodeo
entries.description: A woman died after she was thrown from a horse at a rodeo in the Florida panhandle

entries.title: France's Macron opens up about love to autistic interviewers
entries.description: A group of “atypical journalists” on the autism spectrum got France’s 45-year-old president to talk about himself with unusual and illuminating candor in a televised interview this weekend

entries.title: 2 killed in east Ukraine; Russia claims deadly barracks hit
entries.description: Russia claims it carried out deadly missile strikes on barracks used by Ukraine.

entries.title: Police: Attacker kills 4, then self, in North Carolina home
entries.description: Police say five people were found dead in a North Carolina home, including the person responsible for the attack

entries.title: Homeland Security Secretary Mayorkas dismisses Republican calls to resign over border
entries.description: Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas on Sunday rebuffed calls from leading Republicans to step aside -- or risk impeachment

entries.title: Over 2,000 join LGBTQ march in New Delhi after COVID break
entries.description: More than 2,000 members of the LGBTQ community and their supporters have returned to New Delhi streets after a three-year break caused by the COVID-19 pandemic to press for equal marriage rights

entries.title: Gunmen abduct passengers at train station in Nigeria’s south
entries.description: Police in southern Nigeria say gunmen have abducted several passengers at a train station

entries.title: Palestinian FM: Israel revokes travel permit over UN move
entries.description: The Palestinian foreign minister says Israel has revoked his travel permit, part of a series of punitive steps against the Palestinians that Israel’s new hard-line government announced days ago

entries.title: Police seek info on mother, vehicle as search for missing 11-year-old continues
entries.description: Police searching for a missing 11-year-old are seeking information about a Toyota Prius that they said may have visited a nearby county after the girl went missing.

entries.title: California braces for more rain, storms, potential floods
entries.description: California braced for more stormy weather with rain beginning to sweep into the northern part the state on Saturday

entries.title: Public now can see Benedict's tomb at St. Peter's Basilica
entries.description: The Vatican is allowing the public to visit the new tomb of Pope Benedict XVI under St. Peter's Basilica

entries.title: Travelers rush to take advantage of China reopening
entries.description: After two years of separation from his wife in mainland China, Hong Kong resident Cheung Seng-bun made sure to be among the first in line following the reopening of border crossing points

entries.title: Indian held for unruly behavior with woman on airline flight
entries.description: A woman on an Air India flight from New York said he urinated on her.

entries.title: Seattle schools sue tech giants over social media harm
entries.description: Tech giants behind TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, YouTube and Snapchat are sued.

entries.title: Buffalo Bills' Damar Hamlin makes first statement after cardiac arrest
entries.description: Damar Hamlin thanked those who prayed for him in his first social media post following his on-field cardiac arrest during Monday night's game.
